00024 
00025 #ifndef SFML_CONFIG_HPP
00026 #define SFML_CONFIG_HPP
00027 
00028 
00030 // Define the SFML version
00032 #define SFML_VERSION_MAJOR 2
00033 #define SFML_VERSION_MINOR 0
00034 
00035 
00037 // Identify the operating system
00039 #if defined(_WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__)
00040 
00041     // Windows
00042     #define SFML_SYSTEM_WINDOWS
00043     #ifndef NOMINMAX
00044         #define NOMINMAX
00045     #endif
00046 
00047 #elif defined(linux) || defined(__linux)
00048 
00049     // Linux
00050     #define SFML_SYSTEM_LINUX
00051 
00052 #elif defined(__APPLE__) || defined(MACOSX) || defined(macintosh) || defined(Macintosh)
00053 
00054     // MacOS
00055     #define SFML_SYSTEM_MACOS
00056 
00057 #elif defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined(__FreeBSD_kernel__)
00058 
00059     // FreeBSD
00060     #define SFML_SYSTEM_FREEBSD
00061 
00062 #else
00063 
00064     // Unsupported system
00065     #error This operating system is not supported by SFML library
00066 
00067 #endif
00068 
00069 
00071 // Identify the endianness
00073 #if defined(__m68k__) || defined(mc68000) || defined(_M_M68K) || (defined(__MIPS__) && defined(__MISPEB__)) || \
00074     defined(__ppc__) || defined(__POWERPC__) || defined(_M_PPC) || defined(__sparc__) || defined(__hppa__)
00075 
00076     // Big endian
00077     #define SFML_ENDIAN_BIG
00078 
00079 #else
00080 
00081     // Little endian
00082     #define SFML_ENDIAN_LITTLE
00083 
00084 #endif
00085 
00086 
00088 // Define a portable debug macro
00090 #if !defined(NDEBUG)
00091 
00092     #define SFML_DEBUG
00093 
00094 #endif
00095 
00096 
00098 // Define helpers to create portable import / export macros for each module
00100 #if !defined(SFML_STATIC)
00101 
00102     #if defined(SFML_SYSTEM_WINDOWS)
00103 
00104         // Windows compilers need specific (and different) keywords for export and import
00105         #define SFML_API_EXPORT __declspec(dllexport)
00106         #define SFML_API_IMPORT __declspec(dllimport)
00107 
00108         // For Visual C++ compilers, we also need to turn off this annoying C4251 warning
00109         #ifdef _MSC_VER
00110 
00111             #pragma warning(disable : 4251)
00112 
00113         #endif
00114 
00115     #else // Linux, FreeBSD, Mac OS X
00116 
00117         #if __GNUC__ >= 4
00118 
00119             // GCC 4 has special keywords for showing/hidding symbols,
00120             // the same keyword is used for both importing and exporting
00121             #define SFML_API_EXPORT __attribute__ ((__visibility__ ("default")))
00122             #define SFML_API_IMPORT __attribute__ ((__visibility__ ("default")))
00123 
00124         #else
00125 
00126             // GCC < 4 has no mechanism to explicitely hide symbols, everything's exported
00127             #define SFML_API_EXPORT
00128             #define SFML_API_IMPORT
00129 
00130         #endif
00131 
00132     #endif
00133 
00134 #else
00135 
00136     // Static build doesn't need import/export macros
00137     #define SFML_API_EXPORT
00138     #define SFML_API_IMPORT
00139 
00140 #endif
00141 
00142 
00144 // Define portable fixed-size types
00146 namespace sf
00147 {
00148     // All "common" platforms use the same size for char, short and int
00149     // (basically there are 3 types for 3 sizes, so no other match is possible),
00150     // we can use them without doing any kind of check
00151 
00152     // 8 bits integer types
00153     typedef signed   char Int8;
00154     typedef unsigned char Uint8;
00155 
00156     // 16 bits integer types
00157     typedef signed   short Int16;
00158     typedef unsigned short Uint16;
00159 
00160     // 32 bits integer types
00161     typedef signed   int Int32;
00162     typedef unsigned int Uint32;
00163 
00164     // 64 bits integer types
00165     #if defined(_MSC_VER)
00166         typedef signed   __int64 Int64;
00167         typedef unsigned __int64 Uint64;
00168     #else
00169         typedef signed   long long Int64;
00170         typedef unsigned long long Uint64;
00171     #endif
00172 
00173 } // namespace sf
00174 
00175 
00176 #endif // SFML_CONFIG_HPP
